text: Henry Frick (March 17, 1795 – March 1, 1844) was a Whig member of the U.S. House of Representatives from Pennsylvania. ==Biography== Henry Frick was born in Northumberland, Pennsylvania. He attended the public schools and apprenticed to a printer in Philadelphia. He served in the War of 1812. He settled in Milton, Pennsylvania, in 1816, and established the Miltonian, a political journal, with which he was connected for over twenty years. He was a member of the Pennsylvania House of Representatives from 1828 to 1831. Frick was elected as a Whig to the Twenty-eighth Congress and served until his death in Washington, D.C., in 1844. Interment in the Congressional Cemetery. ==See also== *List of United States Congress members who died in office (1790–1899) ==Sources== *The Political Graveyard Category:1795 births Category:1850 deaths Category:Members of the United States House of Representatives from Pennsylvania Category:Members of the Pennsylvania House of Representatives Category:Burials at the Congressional Cemetery Category:Pennsylvania Whigs Category:Whig Party members of the United States House of Representatives Category:19th-century American politicians
title: Henry Frick (politician)
